American street planners are looking for a source of money to repair the decaying highway system , and believe that they have found the solution in a small black box that can be found in the dark board of each car .

The devices that record each kilometre driven and report the information to the authorities are at the heart of a controversial attempt by Washington and state planning offices to revise the obsolete system of funding for US roads .
The normally rather boring area of road planning has suddenly sparked an intensive debate with colourful alliances .
